title: Before 1 January 2018, will Qatar announce that it will cease to export natural gas to any country?
preds: The timing is all wrong for that move. The economy is not diverse, truly, beyond energy. They would be hurting themselves

36% / 365 =~1% but seeing how the Russians were the instigators and aggressors in shutting down gas to Ukraine, Qatar doesn't fit that. They are the bullied but this time they have the gas. So I'd cut that by 2/3 and therefore get 2/3x 1% which is 0.33% and I am forced to round down. so 0.
Only an attack on the 29th or 30th from a known national directive would cause a shut down.
Not without a serious deterioration in the next day.
Highly unlikely given limited time, lack of chatter
Things in Qatar will only continue  to get  worse.

I've done another analysis of Russia cutting off gas before. It was during the Crimea invasion. I'm going to use that as a base case and adjust from there.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia%E2%80%93Ukraine_gas_disputes
Qatar is in a serious dispute and can punish UAE. Russia shut off gas 4 times in 11 years. Base of 36%.  Qatar really needs the cash, however So I'm lowering it 11%. Beyond just the diplomatic tiff, there seems to be no escalation. So I'll be lowering this in the future if no precursor events occur.
Too late. No obvious rumours suggesting if will happen soon.
Little time for it to happen and economically in Qatarâ€™s best economic interest.
Low chance however parties external to Qatar are slowing things down. Diplomacy seems most likely path.

Despite the current conflict of interest situation with Qatar and neighboring countries it would be too much of a risk for its economy to completely shut off its trade Partnerships with regional members. Most likely Qatar will defend its beliefs and try to defuse the conflict through means of diplomacy and maintain it's self honor through political and diplomatic efforts her rather than cut itself off from economic opportunities.
Low chance, but blockade may be an issue, Iran may want to import to add a new thorn in Saudi's side
This is a VERY confident zero.
Large production in rest of world would nullify most if any impact ...
No Qatar will not unilaterally announce a cessation of natural gas exports to any country.

There is little benefit for any of the countries involved to escalate the crisis, and Qatar is gaining some prestige by refraining from taking dramatic steps to retaliate against its neighbours.  Qatar has a lot more to gain by maintaining its reputation as reliable supplier of gas even during times of crisis.

Qatargas Operating Company Limited (Qatargas) yesterday announced the signing of a new Sale and Purchase Agreement (SPA) with OMV Gas Marketing & Trading GmbH (OMV). Under the terms of the agreement, Qatargas will deliver up to 1.1 million tonnes of Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) per annum to the Austrian company for five years.
https://www.thepeninsulaqatar.com/article/21/12/2017/Qatargas-and-OMV-sign-5-year-LNG-agreement
_______________________
COMMENT: Looks unlikely

Quatar is planning to increase its LNG output by 30% in the next 5 years.  The LNG is an integral part of the countries economy and they are the 4th largest exporter in the world.  Given the sanctions being placed on it the odds are the would not cut anyone off in the near term.
Qatar will not be making that announcement for sure.

1.Qatar is using diplomacy and has not retaliated to date.
http://welcomeqatar.com/articles/qatar-gulf-crisis-questions-answered-3/
It has almost shipped all it has. Trade not stopped in past. http://m.lngworldnews.com/#newsitem-207716
Doubtful for them to do so.
